Hi Gordon,

Thanks for the response.

I had a look at org.archive.crawler.p=
ostprocessor.CandidatesProcessor class.
The method innerProcess of Candidat=
esProcessor class calls runCandidateChain method for each out-candidate and=
 outlink.

Please tell I am going in right direction.
Would it be correct i=
f I change the order of list which I get from  curi.getOutCandidates() and =
curi.getOutLinks()and provide each link to runCandidateChain() method to cr=
awl the outlinks of a page in the order I want?


Thanks in advance.

- Nik=
hil


--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrot=
e:
>
> On 8/4/13 10:38 PM, system.nikhil wrote:
> > My requirement is that =
if there are 10 links on one page, then I want that those 10 links should b=
e crawled in ascending(or descending, random) order as they occur in the pa=
rent page.
> > How can this be possible? Is it feasible to modify the UriPr=
ecedencePolicy and other classes?
> > I am new to this, so it will require =
a lot of time.
> 
> Fine control over the order that links within a single =
page are handled 
> has never been a design goal of Heritrix. In its usual =
crawls, it's most 
> common to get all links from a page, and relatively qu=
ickly, so fine 
> ordering control among them is superfluous.
> 
> FOr your=
 information, generally, the links are discovered on a page 
> top-to-botto=
m, and there's a preference for enqueuing 'embeds' (inline 
> images/script=
s/etc) for fetching before navigational outlinks. There are 
> a few settin=
gs on the 'frontierPreparer' processor that can also 
> slightly bias thing=
s in different directions, but most people shouldn't 
> need to mess with t=
hem (and none of them do your kind of reordering 
> within a page).
> 
> Th=
e reorderings you describe are certainly possible with added code, but 
> n=
ot very useful.
> 
> If you're set on this particular course, know that the=
 various 
> 'extractors' are where Heritrix finds links in content; the 
> =
'CandidatesProcessor' and 'CandidatesChain' are where discovered links 
> a=
re filtered or prepared for insertion into the frontier, and the way 
> the=
y're inserted controls the order they're later fetched. So those are 
> the=
 areas to learn to make the right changes.
> 
> Good luck,
> 
> - Gordon
> =

> > --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Noah Levitt <nlevitt@> wrote:
=
> >>
> >> Hey,
> >>
> >> As I mentioned previously, you can create a custom=
 implementation of
> >> UriPrecedencePolicy to implement your desired crawl=
 order. You can see how
> >> the precedence value you generate is used in
>=
 >> BdbMultipleWorkQueues.calculateInsertKey(CrawlURI). Notably, the preced=
ence
> >> value only accounts for one byte of the insert key, so you're lim=
ited to
> >> 255 precedence levels. There is room for finer customization, =
but that
> >> would involve custom implementations of other classes in addi=
tion to
> >> UriPrecedencePolicy.
> >>
> >> But this
> >> might be more
> >=
>   advanced usage than you'
> >> re
> >>   comfortable with
> >> , especia=
lly if you didn't understand my previous emails.
> >> I'm still not sure wh=
at you're trying to do, exactly. You say "crawl
> >> sequence/ order with A=
scending, Descending or Random", but what are you
> >> sorting by? Alphabet=
ically by url??
> >>
> >> Noah
> >>
> >>
> >> On Thu, Aug 1, 2013 at 5:21 A=
M, system.nikhil <system.nikhil@>wrote:

=

ml config file but was not able
> >>> to find the same.
> >>>
> >>> Can you=
 please tell me how can I provide option to Heritrix, so that it
> >>> can =
set the crawl sequence of queue that it maintains?
> >>>

vance.
